org.arl.fjage.connectors

Class BlockingByteQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.arl.fjage.connectors.BlockingByteQueue

  • public class BlockingByteQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    Byte queue that allows streaming of byte data.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the queue.

      • write

        public void write(int c)
        Writes a byte to the queue.

      • write

        public void write(byte[] buf)
        Writes a byte array to the queue.

      • read

        public int read()
        Reads a byte from the queue. Blocks if no data available.
        Returns:
        byte on success, -1 on failure (interrupt).

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buf)
        Reads a byte array from the queue. Blocks if no data available, but may return a partial buffer if insufficient data available to fill the buffer.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read.

      • readAvailable

        public byte[] readAvailable()
        Reads all available data from the queue. Blocks if no data available.
        Returns:
        bytes array on success, null on failure (interrupt).

      • readDelimited

        public byte[] readDelimited(byte delimiter)
        Reads data from the queue until a delimiter is encountered. Blocks until delimiter is encountered. The returned data includes the delimiter.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - delimiter byte.
        Returns:
        bytes array on success, null on failure (interrupt).

      • available

        public int available()
        Gets the number of bytes available in the buffer.
